Text: FW houston severe weather informationNew feature added to Research page for severe weather Original Message From Bennett Steve Sent Thursday October AM To Roberts Mike A Subject houston severe weather information Can now be found on the research web page commodityWebsENAResearchWeatherportalmainWeatherasp Click Under SPECIAL WEATHER ALERT steve

Sunday WX KZGood Morning Bottom line No Changes Overall US conditions will return to a more normal late fallearly winter pattern no Arctic air over the next days This pattern will persist through the end of the month For the near term Bottom Line Cooler weather will bring temperatures below normal from the beginning through the middle of the week in the Midwest and from the middle through the end of the week in the East and South The below normal event will last to days before normal temperatures return The Rockies and West will be normal to above normal with cooling by the end of the week Details We see some cool anomalies arriving into the Midwest tomorrow with temperatures in Chicago reaching highs late tonight and the mercury falling through the day tomorrow By Tuesday the South and Texas will be in the below normal category with Dallas overnights in the mids normal low Houstons low s normal uppers and Chicago will freeze with a mid overnight Progressing into the Northeast by wednesday Philly and New York will get into the below normal category but or degree anomalies are most likely Looks like a three day event as it moves easterly and then is followed by moderation Day Bottom Line Variable conditions continue with a stormy pattern entrenched over much of the nation Overall temperatures will be normal to cool with very wet conditions NO strong Arctic air is expected Details A strong storm will push into the West late next week and next weekend bringing heavy rain and snow and temperatures near to below normal At the same time the Midwest will warm toward normal with wet conditions developing By early in the last week of November the strong western storm will push into the central US bringing widespread rain and snow Behind the system another surge of below normal temperatures will track from the Midwest to the South to the East Day a generally cool and wet weather pattern will persist over much of the nation While NO Arctic air is clear on the horizon temperatures on a national average will be cooler than normal and there will be an increased threat for rain and snow So with normals dropping across the nation this first cool air anomaly event arriving in the Midwest by Tuesday will elevate the nations gas demand requirements into the Bcfd plus regime from here on through the winter Heres the strip beginning with today Sun Bcfd Mon Bcfd Tue Bcfd Wed Bcfd Thu Bcfd Fri Bcfd Sat Bcfd Sun Bcfd Mon Bcfd Tue Bcfd Till tomorrow The Weather Team

Saturday WX KZGood Morning Bottom line No Changes For the near term we see some cool anomalies arriving into the Dakotas by Monday already with highs in the Dakotas in the mids and lows in the midteensBy Tuesday Texas and the Midwest will be in the below normal category with Dallas overnights in the mids normal low Houstons low in the mids normal uppers and Chicago will freeze with a mid overnight Progressing into the Northeast by wednesday Philly and New York will get into the below normal category but or degree anomalies are most likely Looks like a three day event as it moves easterly and then is followed by moderation into the Day time period which will see a cool shot over the MidwestEast towards next weekend moderating again by early the following week Then early in the Day time period more cool air moves in beginning with central cooling then even into the Southeast So with normals dropping across the nation this first cool air anomaly event arriving in the Midwest by Tuesday will elevate the nations gas demand requirements into the Bcfd plus regime from here on through the winter Heres the strip beginning with today Sat Bcfd Sun Bcfd Mon Bcfd Tue Bcfd Wed Bcfd Thu Bcfd Fri Bcfd Sat Bcfd Sun Bcfd Mon Bcfd Tue Bcfd Till tomorrow The Weather Team

FW Re Hiring for nd Research Meteorologist continuedVince Just FYI to keep you updated on the advanced hiring techniques of the London office We will continue supporting Tonys efforts from Houston but whenever the opportunity arises to hire I hope we can jump on it Mike Original Message From Hamilton Tony Sent Tuesday October AM To Roberts Mike A Cc Bennett Steve Marquez Jose Stevens Adam Subject FW Re Hiring for nd Research Meteorologist continued Importance High FYI ditto my previous message looks like we are back to square one Tony Original Message From Seymour Anna Sent October To Danilov Viacheslav Hamilton Tony Cc Hollis Kate Subject RE Re Hiring for nd Research Meteorologist Absolutely you would need to approach Michael Brown again to get the position reapproved Kate Hollis will be able to advise you about this if the situaton with recruitment changes Anna Original Message From Danilov Viacheslav Sent October To Hamilton Tony Cc Seymour Anna Subject RE Re Hiring for nd Research Meteorologist Tony let us wait for a while with our hiring procedures until we get confirmation from one or another desk that they are prepared to pay for such a person many thanks Slava Original Message From Hamilton Tony Sent October To Seymour Anna Cc Danilov Viacheslav Subject Re Hiring for nd Research Meteorologist Hi Anna I have talked with Slava in research regarding the above Whilst there is currently a hiring freeze we both feel that it is imperative to push ahead with advertising and interviewing of potential candidates for this position in the understanding that with time the hiring freeze will eventually be lifted Hence could we meet at some point next week to discuss the way forward in recruiting for this position Many thanks Tony Hamilton

RE first day in Houston Cc Christian Want you to have not only a smmoth but enjoyable transition to the US I asked Anne Labbe to send you some info Enron can set you all up for days in very nice housing to allow you and Mary and kids to get your feet wet determine what part of town you like etc As far as Im concerned ready for you to join the team as early in January as possible but understand your need to get the family properly situated If the th works out better for you along those lines thats fine with me Mike Original Message From Werner Christian Sent Thursday October PM To Roberts Mike A Subject first day in Houston Hi Mike I would like to finalise the actual first day in Houston I think the earlier I start the better At the moment I can see two possible options Jan nd with a trip prior to organise house and school Jan th where I would arrive early in the year to organise house and school School staff is back on the th Lets discuss Please let me know when I can call you There are also a few other things I need to organise with the various national weather services before I come over to the US Basically we will have top level access to raw data Cheers Christian
FW TFIG Weatherpst Original Message From Bennett Stephen Sent Friday January AM To Roberts Mike A Subject TFIG Weather

RE ENEThursday the nd works for me Mike Original Message From Kaminski Vince J Sent Tuesday November AM To sbigalow ENRON Roberts Mike A Subject RE ENE Hello What about Thu the following week I am going to Baylor on the th Vince Original Message From sbigalow ENRON Sent Monday November PM To Roberts Mike A Kaminski Vince J Subject Re ENE Hey sounds good everybody pencil it in Well confirm as day gets nearer and if Mike wants to go somewhere that serves Spanish Rice that is fine by me also Steve Original Message From Roberts Mike A MikeA NRONcom To Kaminski Vince J VinceJ NRONcom Sent Monday November PM Subject RE ENE Vince Steve Im available any time for dinner other than Mondays or Wednesdays taking Spanish at Rice Thursdays are best then tuesdays next This week though taking off Thursday after work to visit my dad in North Carolina so gone Friday too Even fridays generally OK though Id need to bring Mary Jo Bottom Line How about next Thursday Also the earlier the betteroffice hours ampm looking forward to it Mike Original Message From Kaminski Vince J Sent Monday November PM To sbigalow ENRON Cc Roberts Mike A Subject RE ENE Mike Steve Lets get together What day would work for you Vince Original Message From sbigalow ENRON Sent Monday November AM To Vince Kaminski Subject ENE Good Morning If ENE closes higher than today it will have formed a Kicker signal a strong buy Dinner Steve This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any review use distribution or disclosure by others is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient or authorized to receive for the recipient please contact the sender or reply to Enron Corp at and delete all copies of the message This email and any attachments hereto are not intended to be an offer or an acceptance and do not create or evidence a binding and enforceable contract between Enron Corp or any of its affiliates and the intended recipient or any other party and may not be relied on by anyone as the basis of a contract by estoppel or otherwise Thank you

Heads Up for tomorrows still looks like above normal anomolies focused in central portion of nation west of Chicago they dont progress to the east for the NWS out to lunch with belows EarthSat also has belows in Pacific Northwest and Northeast but probably will be different tomorrow

FW Sunday Weather Update I apologize to those of you who are getting this twice I want to make sur e that everyone gets it Original Message From Bennett Stephen SentSunday June AM ToRoberts Mike A SubjectSunday Weather Update Forwarded by Stephen BennettNAEnron on AM From Stephen Bennett AM ToAllen ome nronXgate John Arnol nronXgate Stephen NRON Mike nro nXgate Grigsby ome nronXgate Ke avey ome nronXgate Kelli om e nronXgate John J nronXgate Lewis ome nronXgate Mike n ronXgate Jose nronXgate Thomas A nronXgate Martin Thomas AHome nronXgate Scott Neal nronXgate Neal ome nronXga te Pereira ome nronXgate Kevin R nronXgate Jim nronXgate Schwieger ome nronXgate Shively ome nronXgate Hunter S n ronXgate Tom ome nronXgate cc SubjectSunday Weather Update Hi Everyone The forecast pattern seems very similar to what weve been talking abou t over the past several days features below normal in the Midwest an d the East with a brief normalization possible toward the Great Lakes next weekend days and before more cool air arrives indicates yet a nother trough digging into the East temperatures normal to below normal w ith the primary ridge remaining in the Southwest above to much above Day forecast also looks similar still quite cool for the East and Mi dwest though not quite as hot for the immediate West Coast Above to muc h above normal temperatures will be common across interior California for m ost of the week with a to day spike of warm temperatures near the coast midweek No prolonged period of heat will affect the Northwest EarthSat will issue an official and forecast around pm tod ay You can get this map by going to miscenron and then follow the Sunday Update link near the bottom Login is e nron Password is enron Maps are attached this is the way we feel things will look to start the d ay tomorrow If there are any changes to this picture it may be to warm the Midwest East closer to normal Right now this solution appears unlik ely but if there are any surprises tomorrow it may be a SLIGHTLY warmer picture for the East Enjoy the rest of your weekend Research Weather Team Embedded Picture Device Independent Bitmap

very similar to what weve been talking abou t over the past several days features below normal in the Midwest an d the East with a brief normalization possible toward the Great Lakes next weekend days and before more cool air arrives indicates yet a nother trough digging into the East temperatures normal to below normal w ith the primary ridge remaining in the Southwest above to much above Day forecast also looks similar still quite cool for the East and Mi dwest though not quite as hot for the immediate West Coast Above to muc h above normal temperatures will be common across interior California for m ost of the week with a to day spike of warm temperatures near the coast midweek No prolonged period of heat will affect the Northwest EarthSat will issue an official and forecast around pm tod ay You can get this map by going to miscenron and then follow the Sunday Update link near the bottom Login is e nron Password is enron Maps are attached this is the way we feel things will look to start the d ay tomorrow If there are any changes to this picture it may be to warm the Midwest East closer to normal Right now this solution appears unlik ely but if there are any surprises tomorrow it may be a SLIGHTLY warmer picture for the East Enjoy the rest of your weekend Research Weather Team Embedded Picture Device Independent Bitmap

Sunday WX KZGood Morning Bottom line No Changes Overall US conditions will return to a more normal late fallearly winter pattern no Arctic air over the next days This pattern will persist through the end of the month For the near term Bottom Line Cooler weather will bring temperatures below normal from the beginning through the middle of the week in the Midwest and from the middle through the end of the week in the East and South The below normal event will last to days before normal temperatures return The Rockies and West will be normal to above normal with cooling by the end of the week Details We see some cool anomalies arriving into the Midwest tomorrow with temperatures in Chicago reaching highs late tonight and the mercury falling through the day tomorrow By Tuesday the South and Texas will be in the below normal category with Dallas overnights in the mids normal low Houstons low s normal uppers and Chicago will freeze with a mid overnight Progressing into the Northeast by wednesday Philly and New York will get into the below normal category but or degree anomalies are most likely Looks like a three day event as it moves easterly and then is followed by moderation Day Bottom Line Variable conditions continue with a stormy pattern entrenched over much of the nation Overall temperatures will be normal to cool with very wet conditions NO strong Arctic air is expected Details A strong storm will push into the West late next week and next weekend bringing heavy rain and snow and temperatures near to below normal At the same time the Midwest will warm toward normal with wet conditions developing By early in the last week of November the strong western storm will push into the central US bringing widespread rain and snow Behind the system another surge of below normal temperatures will track from the Midwest to the South to the East Day a generally cool and wet weather pattern will persist over much of the nation While NO Arctic air is clear on the horizon temperatures on a national average will be cooler than normal and there will be an increased threat for rain and snow So with normals dropping across the nation this first cool air anomaly event arriving in the Midwest by Tuesday will elevate the nations gas demand requirements into the Bcfd plus regime from here on through the winter Heres the strip beginning with today Sun Bcfd Mon Bcfd Tue Bcfd Wed Bcfd Thu Bcfd Fri Bcfd Sat Bcfd Sun Bcfd Mon Bcfd Tue Bcfd Till tomorrow The Weather Team

Saturday WX KZGood Morning Bottom line No Changes For the near term we see some cool anomalies arriving into the Dakotas by Monday already with highs in the Dakotas in the mids and lows in the midteensBy Tuesday Texas and the Midwest will be in the below normal category with Dallas overnights in the mids normal low Houstons low in the mids normal uppers and Chicago will freeze with a mid overnight Progressing into the Northeast by wednesday Philly and New York will get into the below normal category but or degree anomalies are most likely Looks like a three day event as it moves easterly and then is followed by moderation into the Day time period which will see a cool shot over the MidwestEast towards next weekend moderating again by early the following week Then early in the Day time period more cool air moves in beginning with central cooling then even into the Southeast So with normals dropping across the nation this first cool air anomaly event arriving in the Midwest by Tuesday will elevate the nations gas demand requirements into the Bcfd plus regime from here on through the winter Heres the strip beginning with today Sat Bcfd Sun Bcfd Mon Bcfd Tue Bcfd Wed Bcfd Thu Bcfd Fri Bcfd Sat Bcfd Sun Bcfd Mon Bcfd Tue Bcfd Till tomorrow The Weather Team

RE Duke Football Cc PST Jon Two Youre done Looking forward to a great time Me you Jose my wife Mary Jo and your gal will enjoy witnessing the Blue Devils beat the bumblebees of Georgia Ill take care of rooms for Friday and Saturday nites unless I hear from you otherwise Go Blue Mike Original Message From Mckay Jonathan Sent Tuesday August AM To Roberts Mike A Subject RE Duke Football Mike Put me down for two Me and the girl friend would love to go to the game Let me know if you need me to do anything Regards Jon Original Message From Roberts Mike A Sent Monday August AM To Mckay Jonathan Cc Marquez Jose Subject Duke Football hey John As a Blue Devil alumni I have been able to do the impossible actually was able to secure tickets to the Duke football game with some team from Georgia on got an extra one in case you wanted to bring your girlfriend too If you want to practice check out the audio attached File bluewhiteram Ill see if we can crash my old fraternitys party as well Mike
